abstract: White Collar Watch looks at what was left out of the guilty plea agreement made by Drew K. Brownstein, a Denver-based hedge fund manager.
snippet: White Collar Watch looks at what was left out of the guilty plea agreement made by Drew K. Brownstein, a Denver-based hedge fund manager.
lead_paragraph: There are a number of benefits to a plea bargain, not the least of which is the government is much more amenable to drafting the deal in such a way as to reach a mutually agreeable sentence. The recent guilty plea by Drew K. Brownstein to an insider trading charge illustrates how a potential sentence can be reduced by leaving out transactions that lower the gain from the illegal trading.

headline.main: The Vanishing $2.5 Million in Insider Trading Profits
